data.title: Norman Phelps Sr. (1763-1840)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Norman Phelps Sr. born 1763 Hebron, Tolland County, Connecticut died 1840 Ortonville, Oakland County, Michigan, United States including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + Y-chromosome DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 23 Apr 2021 | Created 4 Oct 2012

This page has been accessed 604 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Birth

3 Death

4 Marriage

5 Military

6 Sources

Biography

The Phelps family of America and their English ancestors Vol I. Sixth generation; ancestry.com [1]

Birth

Connecticut Births and Christenings, 1649-1906; familysearch.org [2]

Death

Find A Grave Memorial #9521314 [3] Norman was 76 years old when he died, 7 days after the death of his wife Sarah. He and his wife were buried in the family burying ground on the Ortonville farm of his son, Benjamin Phelps. This family burial ground eventually became the Groveland Cemetery. In1973 it was renamed the Ortonville Cemetery.

Marriage

Connecticut, U.S., Marriage Index, 1620-1926 (Sarah Cole); ancestry.com [4]

Death • Connecticut, Deaths, 1640-1955 - Connecticut Marriages, 1640-1939 (Sarah Cole); familysearch.org [5] The record is listed under Death • Connecticut, Deaths, 1640-1955, the image is under Connecticut Marriages, 1640-1939.

U.S., The Pension Roll of 1835; ancestry.com [8]

U.S., Revolutionary War Rolls, 1775-1783; ancestry.com [9]

Link to a transcription of Norman Phelps description of his service in the Revolutionary War. Part of his pension file. Space:Norman_Phelps_Rev_War_Pension_Affidavit
